articles.summary: Build-A-Bear Workshop's business plummeted during the pandemic, but under CEO Sharon Price John, the company has undergone a significant turnaround.

articles.title: Brick trophies, a life-size pink Cadillac and a team sponsorship: Why Lego is going all in on F1
articles.summary: Lego and Formula 1 kicked off a multiyear partnership in 2025. Here's how that collaboration is providing value to the toy company and the racing organization.

articles.title: Supplements in your stocking: Why wellness gifts are gaining steam for the holidays and beyond
articles.summary: Retailers are blurring the lines between beauty and wellness as customers look for holiday gifts and focus on self-care.

articles.title: Shoppers are focusing on quality, not deals, in the final days before Christmas
articles.summary: Consumers are also increasingly leaning on in-store pickup to get last-minute gifts.

articles.title: Inside the dealmaking that pushed Trump to reclassify pot, expand access
articles.summary: Trump’s pot executive order follows a yearlong industry push blending lobbying, donations and insider access, opening the door to a Medicare CBD pilot.

articles.title: Nine of the largest pharma companies ink deals with Trump to lower drug prices
articles.summary: President Donald Trump has pushed to lower drug prices for Americans, which are on average nearly three times higher than overseas.

articles.title: Wall Street banked on a flurry of deals under Trump in 2025. It wasn't that simple
articles.summary: Dealmakers expected a flood of M&A to take place in 2025 following the election of President Trump. The number of transactions didn't live up to the hype.

articles.title: Classic-car market poised for strong 2026, says Hagerty CEO
articles.summary: A new generation of collectors are more comfortable buying online, with online classic-car sales surging 12% this year to $2.5 billion, according to Hagerty.

articles.title: November home sales struggle as supply stalls
articles.summary: Existing home sales edged slightly higher as prices continued to rise and supply dropped. The higher end of the market is performing better.

articles.title: UnitedHealth Group commits to improvements after independent audit, patient backlash
articles.summary: The company said it has adopted 23 ongoing "action plans" to track and implement recommended improvements, all of which will be completed by the end of March.

articles.title: Trump's 'Gold Card' relies on legal loophole to help wealthy foreigners get U.S. visa
articles.summary: In exchange for $1 million and a $15,000 processing fee, "Gold Card" applicants will get full-time residency in the U.S., the program's website says.
